intro: Vangueria micropyren, commonly known as the small-fruited vangueria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a small, round capsule that contains several seeds. Vangueria micropyren is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
